moves.1. e4 Nf6 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. Nf3 e5 4. Bc4 Na: White decides to go for broke with the B-sac.
moves.5... Kxf7 6. Nxe5+: continues checking while snatching up a center pawn.
moves.6... Ke6:
better is 6....Kh8.
 
this move exposes black's K.
moves.7. d4 d6 8. Nf3 Kf7 9. Ng5+ Kg6:
again, better is Kh8!
 
this time black's K is ompletely unable to recover from its exposure.
moves.10. f4 h6 11. f5+:
black has 1 recourse against this mating move.
 
from here on out the moves are forced. black is done.
moves.11... Bxf5 12. exf5+ Kxf5 13. Qd3+: white could have played 13.0-0, but 13.Qd3 mates faster.
moves.13... Kg4: intercession with the N only gains black 1 move.
moves.14. Qf3+: the Q placement takes away black's escape route around the g5-N via h5.
moves.14... Kh4 15. g3#:
how many times do we get to checkmate wih a pawn??
 
15.Qh3 also mates.
